reviews.review_msg: Comments here are really dramatic. In reality Silverman is actually a really good prof and easy to talk to. He gives easy exams because he wants his students to actually feel like theyve learned something. The grading scheme makes it so that the avg is B- just like every other bisc/mbb class. He doesnt deserve this crazy low rating imo.
He is an overall great person. Sure his scale is a little tough, but it is very realistic. The course is easy so for you to stand out it is important to outdo the class.

His lectures aren't very helpful, but he will give you a ton of extra information on the topic that you won't be tested on in class. Grading scheme is bad. Honestly, just do yourself a favor, and take it with a different professor because it will be a lot easier.

Alright, many people find this prof hard because of his grading scheme. Yes, an 87 can sometimes be a B+ in his class but its only cause his class average is around 80%. Its not that hard of a course, its memorization mainly (but if you're in bio what did you expect).
ridiculous grading scheme.

The WORST PROF of SFU! I got 69% overall after all my finals and midterms and he gave me a C-. He has his own grading scheme with +/- S.D. which is completely non sense. AVOID HIM! Shouting at students is his nature and he loves doing that. If you are getting a call from your work or anything urgent dont pick it up becoz he will SLAM you...........
Just terrible professor who does not care about student's future. AVOID

This class was ridiculous. His grading scale is absolutely absurd and makes students who actually do well receive low final grades because he decides to SCALE UP a class that doesn't need to be scaled! Very unapproachable in lecture and outside lecture. He yells at students if he sees their phones instead of actually TEACHING. AVOID HIM.
RUINED MY FUTURE! JUST AWFUL GUY THAT YOU SHOULD AVOID AT ANY COST.. WILL BE MY LOWEST MARK IN MY UNI LIFE CAUSE OF HIS BS GRADING SCHEME .. 70% is a C-
AVOID!! only if youre straight A student and able to get 96%.. since A range start from 96

Professor Silverman makes an unpleasant course a great one. His tutorials are designed to make you think, and his midterms are fair. Always open to questions, very knowledgeable and approachable. His interest in the course is evident, and he is known to crack a joke or two during lecture

Yes, he has a crazy grading scale. BUT, if you put in the effort, you'll get the grade. His exams are fair and leniently marked. His notes can be a bit confusing at times, but ask him about it and he clears it up! If you need an amazing grade in this class, it might be a bit of a gamble. However, make sure to take his bisc403!!

Exams were very straight forward. However the conversion to a letter grade was questionable. Low 90's got me an A, but I know several people who got a B+ with very high 80's... no A- as far as I know. Still, I enjoyed the class and found the material very interesting.
I GOT 87% IN THIS COURSE AND GOT A B+. grading scheme is ridiculous and no scale. If you are not going get 90%+ you should avoid .

Exams arent hard, but his grading scheme is definitely bunk! he knows that himself too so he never gives you the exact cut offs for each grade.very arrogant.stops lecture and yells at students when he sees them texting. do urself a favor and stay away from this guy! I don't care if this class is a pre-req! grad a year l8r but don't take his class!!

very bad prof. yes the exams are relatively easy but that fact does not make the prof "good". He doesnt know much about mbb but i dont blame him because hes in bio. his grading scheme COMPLETELY DOESNT MAKE SENCE and he is not able to communicate AT ALL. 88% is a B+ UNREAL

Garbage prof. Avoid at all costs. Exams are easy but grading scheme is completely ridiculous.He uses his useless American grading scheme which doesn't make sence (were in CANADA). Everything he says in class is useless and he does not know anything about the subject himself. I honestly do not know how this guy is allowed to teach
Very tough grading scale, need at least a 90 just to score within the A range, above 80 for the B range. He's a decent prof though; study the big picture concepts rather than specific details.

Dr. Silverman is an interesting prof but his marking scheme is ridiculous. To pass with a C- you need to have 70%. His exams are straightforward but he does try to trick you because he makes the exam conceptual rather than straight memorization. Do I recommend this class? Yes and No. If you can put in the effort necessary, then you will do well.
Excellent professor. One of my most enjoyable profs to date. Exams are fair and straightforward. Watch out for the marking scheme though!

as i take his course. i figure he is great. the stuffs he teaches you could actually remember. i meant his style. i think this would be benefit for the students. But to get a great grade could be a challenge. We see how it goes
he is so chill. he told us not to memerize amino acid for the exam. but end up giving us an amino sequence to figure things out. midterm was hard but if your in biology major then u shouuld be fine.

Agree with what the person below said. I ended with 78% and that was a C+. His tests aren't very efficient in demonstrating the good students from the less good ones. He has a lot of interest in the subject, I'll give him that, but I am DEFINITELY not taking another class with him.

Would not recommend this prof, just because of his marking style and his terrible notes. His notes consist of pictures of cells and processes with absolutely no textual information. You will have to depend on your textbook a lot. He marks on the American scale so you wont get an A unless you get 90 and above. 70-80 = C lol. Smart guy though...

Will not tolerate talking in class, cellphones or using laptops for things other than school. That being said, he is very straight forward with his explanations providing you attend lectures and pay attention. Exams were tough but fair. No scaling of grades, so what you get is what you'll end up with. Enjoyable, informative teacher overall.

Very nice and intelligent prof who is clear in his lectures. Lecture notes are usually pictures, which is why you need to listen to what he says and take notes. Lets you know what will be on the exams (Questions are similar to tutorials). Highly recommended!

Great prof. Fair exams. Lectures were super easy to pay attention in because he's a great communicator. He has a large vocabulary which makes it rather comical, and he really knows what he's talking about. This class is not hard, especially if you read the textbook, and especially if you don't try to cram it all the night before.

Good prof overall..he's smart and knows his stuff well. Yes he uses long complicated words sometimes, and yes the notes are filled with lots of pictures. Find the pictures in the textbook and read the captions underneath..i found that very helpful!

His willingness to teach is represented on behalf of his decision of staying home to celebrate AMERICAN thanksgiving rather than coming to school teaching an important topic that is HEAVILY emphasized on the final exam.  This professor is just not very interested into teaching.

This man is the worst teacher i have had during my four years at sfu!he also gave me the worst grade i have ever had in my 22 years of life. His notes are not notes, they are pictures from the text book WITHOUT words. once he gave a slide with a pic of processes that occur in the cell..his NOTE for this slide was: 'cell'. the textbook sucks.
Dr. Silverman or the Dr. House the second :). The course is not easy, but he is not a good instructor either. I passed, but I studied a lot. Avoid him if it is possible.

Very monotone, speaks slow, but tells you EXACTLY what's on the exam. An entertaining and sassy (in a good way) woman who does show up late sometimes. If you need to take further MBB courses after 231, maybe look into another prof. She skips some information that, "we don't need to know", but other people need to know for future MBB courses

AMAZING, anyone who says otherwise just didnt put in work. Tells u exactly whats on exams, repeats things several times to get it to stick in ur head. Slow speaker but otherwise fine. Not sure why theres reviews on not getting through the slide deck... we covered 2 extra chapters and still had classes left over. Just need to know all material well

ingrid is amazing she makes it really clear what you're going to be tested on. i also like that she repeated things often cause it made them stick in my mind. be aware this class is pretty content heavy. i have no complaints other than how ingrid was pretty late to the lecture a lot of the time.

She tells you clearly what you should know for the exams and the exams themselves are purely based on learning objectives. She is very straightforward and her class is easy if you put in the effort. I highly suggest using Wiley Plus.

She's very sweet but is completely inept at using her slides. Half of the classes, she would show up late and then we would only cover a bit of the slide deck we were supposed to. She tells you exactly what's on the exam which is definitely helpful, but if 231 was a difficult course, then she would be a nightmare.

She let any student who had Eras Tour tickets write the 231 final 5 days later to ensure they had a "once in a lifetime opportunity." Her exams are pretty hard but so fair. She always tells you exactly what to study. Most questions come from practice problems/tests. She's an okay lecturer but she's so cool and funny that it kinda makes up for it.
Dr. Northwood is a straightforward prof - lectures are clear, and she gives you the exact info needed to do well on exams. Unstuck study helped with practice quizzes.

She is great. I did not like MBB classes before this one, but she made it interesting. lectures are recorded and she is entertaining to listen to. She is very understanding and kind. definitely take MBB courses with her over many of the other profs.

During lecture she tells you which slides you don't need to focus on (you end up scrapping like 5 slides out of a set which is helpful when it comes to studying). If you study lecture notes=golden for exams. She's very chill and she's even letting students write their finals on different days because it overlaps with the Taylor Swift concert

Love her. Single-handedly restored my faith in MBB. 90% first midterm and 100% on the second.  All I did was take her advice. Keep up with the lecture material, do the assigned textbook questions, and practice problem sets. No tricks on exams..exactly what she said is on it.
very chill prof, for review lectures, she tells you exactly whats going to be on exams, straight forward lectures, and no mandatory attendance

Dr. Northwood is one of, if not the best professor at SFU. Lectures are always engaging and easy to follow, and if you are confused about something, she is more than willing to help you understand a certain topic. Very clear grading criteria, with an easy 100% for 10% of your grade from the Canvas quizzes. Tests are simple and straight forward!

She has a great sense of humour and is extremely clear on what is to be expected on the tests. Can't stress enough how important it is to go over her assigned Wiley+ & Canvas Quiz assignments as they were extremely helpful in preparing for and doing well on exams. She dedicated 1-2 classes for review which was extremely helpful as well!
She just read from the slide and encouraged students to memorize rather than learn! You only pass the exam only if you can memorize all the questions and answers from Wiley Plus.

Not the worst professor, but teaching skill really is exceptionally bad. She simply reads out lecture slides and gives no clear explanations on most topics, and she frequently skips multiple slides in lecture...

Incompetent teaching style that will make you sleep every single lecture. The average in the midterms are rather high, but the grading scheme were scaled down, meaning my 80% merely makes a B instead of a B+.

Dr. Northwood is a godsend for this class. There is a lot of material to cover, but she will let you know EXACTLY what will be on her exams, so it makes studying a lot less challenging. Her exams are mostly multiple-choice, and if you do the optional practice questions, then it should be easy for you to do ok. 

Take this class with her if you can!

Dr.Northwood is great! Her lectures feel like there's a lot of knowledge to be learned and overwhelming but she gives you lots of online practice questions (that she also bases her exams on) that make studying much easier and totally doable. All her exams felt fair and relative to what we learned. Would totally recommend!

Dr. Northwood is a caring, sassy and funny professor. She isn't trying to trick you like other professors do. She will make it clear what to study for the exam (at least for this course) and both her and the TA will hold review sessions before the exam to prepare you. Highly recommended.

Loved my class with Dr. Northwood! She is funny and sassy which makes lectures interesting. She also tells you exactly what will be on the exams so the review sessions are super helpful. Grade came from 4 exams (no assignments), tuts were very helpful but not mandatory. Definitely recommend and will be taking another class with her in the future!

Dr. Northwood is a good lecturer. She can sometimes get a bit disorganized, and can sometimes talk too fast, but overall she is receptive to comments on her lecture pace and content. Her review sessions tell you exactly what will be on the exam.. The Wiley "practice" questions are copied word for word on to the exams as MC questions, so do those!
Not a bad prof but her grading is unfair. if you mess up one exam you won't be able to improve it.
Dr. Northwood is a godsend. She is crystal clear on what the main concepts are, and her reviews for exams are concise and informative. Her tests are fair, and she's very approachable.

Dr. Northwood is the best prof I have taken at SFU. So passionate about biochemistry and extremely kind! The material is very difficult but she made it so interesting and fun to learn. She's the reason I chose MBB as my major!

This class was one of the best classes Ive taken in awhile. The prof was just overall so thoughtful and caring, she made all her tests extremely fair. To do well on the exams, I recommend pretty much memorizing all the lecture slides & doing the Wiley plus/assignment questions (I didnt read the textbook much). Its very easy if you put in effort!
Ingrid is amazing. Her lectures are fun and she really cares about her students! MBB stuff is always difficult but her exams are extremely fair.

Dr. Northwood is such a cute professor. We faced several technical difficulties in this class, and I felt really bad for her since she didn't know what else to do. However, her exams were questions based on WileyPLUS, and she will tell you specifically what to study. She is very sweet and teaches you a lot to learn!

She has an adjusted grading scale that makes 81% a B- and she has made no adaptations for students during covid 19. Her excuse is that she always done it this way. Has their always been a pandemic???? trash teacher.
shes awesome

Dr. Northwood made MBB 231 as painless as she possibly could. She clearly explained what would be on the exams, emphasized the most important material, and streamlined the material so that studying became a lot less overwhelming. Lectures often started with a funny anecdote, and she added a lot of humour to the sometimes dry material.
The most amazing personality that i have met . She is one of The BEST professor and I will remember her my entire life . Thank you Dr. Northwood I will take every class that you will teach .
Great

She gives 5 midterms and a cumulative final, but her finals is just questions straight from the past 4 midterms. Midterms are ok. At the end of every lecture slides she will point out which parts will be asked on the the test. Overall, its an easy pass class. Just read her slides and use the textbook if you want further detail.

honestly one of the slackest class I have ever taken. a lot of the midterm questions are straight off the online quizzes. The cumulative final was almost all reused questions. However she can be disorganized but she does know what she's talking about. Take her if you want an easy grade but if you want the best prof you may want to hold off.

Overall good prof. She always throws in interesting tidbits of information that apply to the material needed to be known. Tests pretty straight forward, reuses a lot of textbook questions + online quiz mc. Claims that she "doesn't trick you" in tests, but definitely is picky w/ the answer key. Overall, glad I took MBB231 with her, learnt a lot.

AVOID THIS PROF IF YOU CAN! Her marking schemes are ridiculously high, majority of people failed during summer 2012 so that is saying something. Exams were fair once you figured out her exam style but even then it is not straightforward as she suggests. She is NOT APPROACHABLE. Make sure to review your questions before asking her or she will attack

Very down to earth and funny! Only three exams, no assignments. Tests were super fair and so was the marking. Just do the assigned text and online questions and study the notes. If you can put an effort into doing that then you'll do great! I ended up with 90% =)

After the first class I was overwhelmed - Dr. Northwood posts about 50 slides per lecture and I wasn't looking forward to her class at all. But although there is a lot of material, she makes it clear what's going to be on the exams and where to focus your studying. Each lecture contains objectives at the end - focus on those! She's also a comedian.

Dr. Northwood is not a hard prof. She tells you EXACTLY what will be on her exams. Do the practice exams, and the textbook questions she assigns. It still requires a great deal of time, but she definitely makes the course easier.
